verifiedIssues.title: ODSP Maximum Rate: $1,308/month for Single Adult
verifiedIssues.summary: Ontario Disability Support Program provides maximum $1,308/month basic needs + shelter for single recipients, far below poverty line. Rate increased 6.5% in July 2024 but remains inadequate.
verifiedIssues.action: Support Raise the Rates campaign - https://raisingtherates.ca

verifiedIssues.title: AISH (Alberta): $1,863/month Maximum Benefit
verifiedIssues.summary: Assured Income for the Severely Handicapped provides maximum $1,863/month for single adults as of 2024. Income and assets affect eligibility.
verifiedIssues.action: Contact Alberta MLA about AISH adequacy

verifiedIssues.title: BC Disability Assistance: $1,483.50/month
verifiedIssues.summary: Persons with Disabilities (PWD) designation provides $1,483.50/month maximum for single adults in British Columbia as of 2024.
verifiedIssues.action: Support BC disability advocacy organizations

verifiedIssues.title: Canada Disability Benefit Act Passed - Regulations Pending
verifiedIssues.summary: Bill C-22 (Canada Disability Benefit Act) received Royal Assent June 22, 2023. Regulations to determine benefit amounts still pending as of late 2024. Implementation timeline uncertain.
verifiedIssues.action: Contact MP to demand rapid CDB implementation with adequate rates

verifiedIssues.title: Long-Term Drinking Water Advisories: 28 Remain on First Nations
verifiedIssues.summary: As of November 18, 2025, 28 long-term drinking water advisories remain on public systems on First Nations reserves. 143 have been lifted since 2015. Recent additions: Asubpeeschoseewagong (Aug 2025), Shawanaga (July 2025).
verifiedIssues.sourceName: Indigenous Services Canada - Official Water Advisory Tracker
verifiedIssues.action: Demand immediate federal infrastructure investment

verifiedIssues.title: MMIWG: 231 Calls for Justice Issued in 2019
verifiedIssues.summary: The National Inquiry into Missing and Murdered Indigenous Women and Girls released 231 Calls for Justice in June 2019. Implementation tracking varies by organization. Federal government releases annual progress reports.
verifiedIssues.action: Support Indigenous-led organizations tracking implementation

verifiedIssues.title: First Nations Child Welfare: $23.34 Billion Settlement
verifiedIssues.summary: In 2022, the Federal Court approved a $23.34 billion settlement for First Nations children and families harmed by discriminatory child welfare funding. Compensation distribution ongoing.
verifiedIssues.sourceName: Indigenous Services Canada - Child Welfare Settlement
verifiedIssues.action: Ensure affected families receive compensation

verifiedIssues.title: TRC: 94 Calls to Action - Implementation Tracking
verifiedIssues.summary: The Truth and Reconciliation Commission issued 94 Calls to Action in 2015. Progress tracked by various organizations including CBC Beyond 94 project.
verifiedIssues.action: Monitor implementation of Calls to Action

verifiedIssues.title: Toronto Shelter System: Daily Census Data Available
verifiedIssues.summary: City of Toronto publishes daily shelter census data. System regularly operates at 98%+ capacity with thousands in shelter system nightly. Check source for current numbers.
verifiedIssues.sourceName: City of Toronto - Shelter System Flow Data
verifiedIssues.action: Demand emergency shelter expansion and housing investment

verifiedIssues.title: BC Homeless Counts: Provincial Data Available
verifiedIssues.summary: BC Housing publishes homeless count data for communities across British Columbia. Point-in-time counts conducted regularly in major municipalities.
verifiedIssues.action: Support Housing First initiatives

verifiedIssues.title: National Housing Strategy: $82+ Billion Commitment
verifiedIssues.summary: Canada's National Housing Strategy is a 10-year, $82+ billion plan launched in 2017 to create new housing supply and reduce homelessness. Progress reports available.
verifiedIssues.sourceName: Place to Call Home - National Housing Strategy
verifiedIssues.action: Monitor NHS progress and advocate for accelerated investment

verifiedIssues.title: Ontario LTC: 4 Hours Direct Care Standard
verifiedIssues.summary: Ontario committed to 4 hours of direct care per resident per day in long-term care homes. FAO and Auditor General report on implementation progress.
verifiedIssues.action: Monitor FAO reports on LTC staffing progress

verifiedIssues.title: Ontario LTC Commission: COVID-19 Inquiry Report
verifiedIssues.summary: Ontario Long-Term Care COVID-19 Commission released final report April 2021 with 85 recommendations. Documented systemic failures in long-term care homes.
verifiedIssues.sourceName: Ontario LTC COVID-19 Commission Final Report
verifiedIssues.action: Demand implementation of all 85 recommendations

verifiedIssues.title: OAS/GIS: Payment Rates Updated Quarterly
verifiedIssues.summary: Old Age Security (OAS) and Guaranteed Income Supplement (GIS) rates are adjusted quarterly. Check source for current maximum rates.
verifiedIssues.action: Ensure all eligible seniors receive full entitlements

verifiedIssues.title: Opioid Toxicity Deaths: 8,049 in 2023 (PHAC Data)
verifiedIssues.summary: Public Health Agency of Canada tracks opioid and stimulant toxicity deaths. In 2023, there were 8,049 apparent opioid toxicity deaths in Canada. 2024/2025 data published quarterly.
verifiedIssues.sourceName: PHAC Opioid and Stimulant-Related Harms Dashboard
verifiedIssues.action: Support harm reduction and safe supply programs

verifiedIssues.title: Federal Mental Health Transfer: $5 Billion over 10 Years
verifiedIssues.summary: Budget 2023 announced $5 billion over 10 years for provincial/territorial mental health and substance use services via bilateral agreements.
verifiedIssues.action: Monitor how provinces deploy mental health funding

verifiedIssues.title: BC Drug Decriminalization: Jan 2023 - Jan 2026 Exemption
verifiedIssues.summary: British Columbia received federal exemption under CDSA to decriminalize possession of small amounts of certain drugs (up to 2.5g) from Jan 31, 2023 to Jan 31, 2026.
verifiedIssues.action: Monitor decriminalization outcomes and policy evolution

verifiedIssues.title: Bill 86: Meredith Act (Fair Compensation for Injured Workers), 2025
verifiedIssues.summary: Private Member's Bill introduced December 8, 2025 by Lise Vaugeois (NDP-Thunder Bay-Superior North), co-sponsored by Wayne Gates and Jamie West. Would repeal WSIA 1997 and establish new Workers' Compensation Commission of Ontario with worker-focused reforms.
verifiedIssues.action: Contact your MPP to support Bill 86

verifiedIssues.title: WSIB Annual Reports: Claim Statistics Published Yearly
verifiedIssues.summary: Workplace Safety and Insurance Board publishes annual reports with claim statistics, allowed claims, appeal rates, and financial data. Check source for latest data.
verifiedIssues.action: Review WSIB statistics and advocate for injured workers

verifiedIssues.title: Ontario Minimum Wage: $17.20/hour (Oct 2024)
verifiedIssues.summary: Ontario general minimum wage increased to $17.20/hour effective October 1, 2024. Students under 18 and liquor servers have different rates.
verifiedIssues.action: Support living wage advocacy

verifiedIssues.title: Bill C-58: Anti-Replacement Workers Act Passed June 2024
verifiedIssues.summary: Bill C-58 (Canada Labour Code amendment) received Royal Assent June 20, 2024. Prohibits use of replacement workers during strikes/lockouts in federally regulated workplaces. In force June 2025.
verifiedIssues.action: Ensure enforcement in federal workplaces

verifiedIssues.title: Temporary Foreign Worker Program: 2024 Reforms
verifiedIssues.summary: Federal government announced TFWP reforms in August 2024 including reducing low-wage stream cap from 20% to 10% and ending LMIA exemptions for some streams.
verifiedIssues.action: Monitor impact on migrant workers and advocate for pathways to PR

verifiedIssues.title: IRB Refugee Claims: Statistics Published Quarterly
verifiedIssues.summary: Immigration and Refugee Board publishes quarterly statistics on refugee claims received, finalized, and pending. Check source for current backlog and wait times.
verifiedIssues.action: Advocate for faster refugee processing

verifiedIssues.title: $10/Day Childcare: Provincial Implementation Ongoing
verifiedIssues.summary: Canada-Wide Early Learning and Child Care agreements signed with all provinces/territories. Target: average $10/day regulated childcare by 2025-26. Progress varies by province.
verifiedIssues.action: Monitor childcare fee reductions in your province

verifiedIssues.title: Child Poverty: Statistics Canada Data Available
verifiedIssues.summary: Statistics Canada publishes child poverty rates using various measures (LICO, MBM, LIM). Canada Child Benefit introduced 2016 reduced child poverty but gaps remain.
verifiedIssues.action: Support anti-poverty programs
